bugs.title: CVE-2018-6952 patch: Double free of memory in pch.c:another_hunk() causes a crash [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-6952 patch: Double free of memory in pch.c:another_hunk() causes a crash [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-6952 patch: Double free of memory in pch.c:another_hunk() causes a crash

long_desc.thetext:
GNU patch through version 2.7.6 is vulnerable to a double freeing of memory when supplied a crafted patch file leading to a crash.

Upstream Issue:

https://savannah.gnu.org/bugs/index.php?53133

Created patch tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1545054]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2019:2033 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2033

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-6952

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1545053,1545054

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
this issue is not fixed in patch-2.7.6-2.fc27 and still happen in latest patch version.

This has been fixed upstream in commit 9c986353 "Fix swapping fake lines in pch_swap":
  http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/patch.git/commit/?id=9c986353e420ead6e706262bf204d6e03322c300

patch-2.7.6-7.fc29 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 29. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-90af6f5b8a

bugs.title: Patch can be crashed and coredumped with a trivial wrong command

bugzilla.short_desc: Patch can be crashed and coredumped with a trivial wrong command

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1441726
Example showing the bug

Description of problem:

Patch spews errors then segmentation faults when given a valid patch file and suitable bogus command line

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):


How reproducible:

100%

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Go into a directory that does not contain the file "_R"
2. cat patch | patch -p1 _R   (not _R not -R)
3.enjoy

Actual results:

Giant error spew and a core dump

Expected results:

An error

Additional info:

Any old patch file seems to work but I've attached the one I found it with

Created attachment 1445775
Minimal reproducer

Thanks. I've attached a minimal reproducer. The command line to reproduce it is:

patch -i diff foo

where foo is any non-existent filename.

The problem is that patch enters an infinite recursion when trying to create a backup for the original (non-existent) file:

...
#161 0x0000555555566496 in create_backup (to=0x5555557896a0 "foo", 
    to_st=0x55555578b238, leave_original=<optimized out>) at util.c:419
#162 0x000055555555cf02 in output_files (st=0x0) at patch.c:1949
#163 0x000055555555d93c in fatal_exit (sig=sig@entry=0) at patch.c:1978
#164 0x00005555555657cb in pfatal (
    format=format@entry=0x5555555792d0 "Can't reopen file %s") at util.c:985
#165 0x0000555555565d1d in copy_to_fd (from=from@entry=0x5555557896a0 "foo", 
    tofd=tofd@entry=4) at util.c:603
#166 0x0000555555565eca in copy_file (from=0x5555557896a0 "foo", 
    to=0x5555557886d0 "foo.orig", tost=0x0, to_flags=<optimized out>, 
    mode=<optimized out>, to_dir_known_to_exist=<optimized out>) at util.c:647
#167 0x000055555556607e in create_backup_copy (
    from=from@entry=0x5555557896a0 "foo", 
    to=to@entry=0x5555557886d0 "foo.orig", st=st@entry=0x55555578b238, 
    to_dir_known_to_exist=<optimized out>) at util.c:326
#168 0x0000555555566496 in create_backup (to=0x5555557896a0 "foo", 
    to_st=0x55555578b238, leave_original=<optimized out>) at util.c:419
#169 0x000055555555cf02 in output_files (st=0x0) at patch.c:1949
#170 0x000055555555b907 in main (argc=<optimized out>, argv=<optimized out>)
    at patch.c:683

Looks like this was already reported upstream (several times), with a [potential fix:
* http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-patch/2018-02/msg00010.html
* http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-patch/2018-03/msg00000.html
* http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-patch/2018-05/msg00000.html
*** Bug 1607696 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
